name: W.H. Harrison
description: On April 4, 1841, W.H. Harrison died of pneumonia, ending his presidency after 1 month, and was succeeded by John Tyler.

name: Taylor
description: On July 9, 1850, Zachary Taylor died of cholera or gastroenteritis, ending his presidency after 16 months, and was succeeded by Millard Fillmore.

name: Lincoln
description: On April 15, 1865, Abraham Lincoln died of assassination, ending his presidency after 4 years and 1 month, and was succeeded by Andrew Johnson.

name: Garfield
description: On September 19, 1881, James A. Garfield died of assassination, ending his presidency after 6 months, and was succeeded by Chester A. Arthur.

name: McKinley
description: On September 14, 1901, William McKinley died of assassination, ending his presidency after 4 years and 6 months, and was succeeded by Theodore Roosevelt.

name: Harding
description: On August 2, 1923, Warren G. Harding died of a heart attack or stroke, ending his presidency after 2 years and 5 months, and was succeeded by Calvin Coolidge.

name: FDR
description: On April 12, 1945, Franklin D. Roosevelt died of a cerebral hemorrhage, ending his presidency after 12 years and 1 month, and was succeeded by Harry S. Truman.
